<script type="text/javascript">
var maindomain_lang = 'https://www.paloaltonetworks.com';
var main_site_url = 'https://www.paloaltonetworks.com';
var ajax_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-admin/admin-ajax.php';	
function getParameterByName(name, url) {
		if(url == null){
		  url = window.location.href;
		}
	    name = name.replace(/[\[\]]/g, '\\$&');
	    var regex = new RegExp('[?&]' + name + '(=([^&#]*)|&|#|$)'),
		results = regex.exec(url);
	    if (!results) return null;
	    if (!results[2]) return '';
	    return decodeURIComponent(results[2].replace(/\+/g, ' '));
	}
	var container_q = getParameterByName('container');
	var d_lang = 'en';	
</script>

<meta property="og:readtime" content="7"/>
<meta property="og:views" content="61,417"/>
<meta property="og:date_created" content="October 25, 2016 at 9:29 AM"/>

<meta property="og:author" content="Anthony Kasza"/>
<meta property="og:authorlink" content="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/author/anthony-kasza/"/>
<meta property="og:author_image_link" content="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/unit-news-meta.svg"/>
<meta name="post_tags" content="Houdini,Hworm,Malcode,Middle East,threat research"/>
<script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https:\/\/schema.org","@type":"BlogPosting","headline":"Houdini\u2019s Magic Reappearance","name":"Houdini\u2019s Magic Reappearance","description":"Unit 42 has observed a new version of Hworm (or Houdini) being used within multiple attacks. This blog outlines technical details of this new Hworm version and documents an attack campaign making use of the backdoor. Of the samples used in this attack, the first we observed were June 2016, while as-of publication we were","url":"https:\/\/unit42.paloaltonetworks.com\/unit42-houdinis-magic-reappearance\/","mainEntityOfPage":"https:\/\/unit42.paloaltonetworks.com\/unit42-houdinis-magic-reappearance\/","datePublished":"October 25, 2016","articleBody":"Unit 42 has observed a new version of Hworm (or Houdini) being used within multiple attacks. This blog outlines technical details of this new Hworm version and documents an attack campaign making use of the backdoor. Of the samples used in this attack, the first we observed were June 2016, while as-of publication we were still seeing attacks as recently as mid-October, suggesting that this is likely an active, ongoing campaign.\nDeconstructing the Threats:\nThe investigation into this malware began while searching through WildFire execution reports within AutoFocus. Looking for newly submitted malicious samples with no family label, a unique mutex surfaced, \u201cRCSTEST\u201d. Pivoting around the creation of this mutex, as well as other dynamic behaviors, a group of samples slowly began to emerge. The group of samples has common delivery mechanisms, lures and decoy file themes, payloads (Hworm), as well as control infrastructure.\n\nSamples from this attack came in the form of SFX files. The original filenames of these delivery files are related to political figures and groups in the Middle East and the Mediterranean. They include:\nMohamed Dahlan Abu Dhabi Meeting.exe\n\u0641\u0636\u064a\u062d\u0629 \u0645\u0646 \u0627\u0644\u0639\u064a\u0627\u0631 \u0627\u0644\u062b\u0642\u064a\u0644 \u0627\u0631\u062f\u0648\u063a\u0627\u0646 \u064a\u0634\u0631\u0628 \u0627\u0644\u062e\u0645\u0631.exe\n\u0635\u0631\u0627\u0639\u0627\u062a \u062f\u0627\u062e\u0644\u064a\u0629 \u0641\u064a \u0635\u0641\u0648\u0641 \u0627\u0644\u0627\u062e\u0648\u0627\u0646 \u0627\u0644\u0645\u0633\u0644\u0645\u064a\u0646.exe\n\u0639\u0645\u0644\u064a\u0629 \u0627\u063a\u062a\u064a\u0627\u0644 \u0627\u0644\u062f\u0643\u062a\u0648\u0631 \u0645\u062d\u0645\u062f \u0643\u0645\u0627\u0644.scr\n\u0627\u0644\u0645\u0644\u0643 \u0639\u0628\u062f \u0627\u0644\u0644\u0647 \u064a\u0647\u062f\u062f \u062f\u0648\u0644 \u0627\u0644\u062e\u0644\u064a\u062c \u0648\u064a\u062a\u0648\u0639\u062f \u062f\u062d\u0644\u0627\u0646.exe\n\u0628\u0627\u0644\u0641\u064a\u062f\u064a\u0648 \u0627\u0645\u064a\u0631 \u0633\u0639\u0648\u062f\u064a \u064a\u0647\u064a\u0646 \u0645\u0648\u0627\u0637\u0646\u064a\u0646 \u0639\u0644\u0649 \u0627\u0644\u0647\u0648\u0627\u0621.scr\nWhen executed each SFX file opens a decoy document, video, or URL, and eventually executes an Hworm payload in the background. The decoy files are similarly themed when compared to the above delivery file names. Figure 1 shows a screenshot from a video one sample opens as a decoy.\n\n\nFigure 1 Decoy video\nAnother sample displays a YouTube video by dropping a .url shortcut and opening it using the system\u2019s default web browser. Figure 2 illustrates the .url file contents:\n\n\n\nFigure 2 .url file\n\nWhen the .url file is opened, the above YouTube video is displayed as a decoy. It is unclear at this time if the uploader of this video has any relation to this particular attack\n\nBesides decoys, the samples also execute Hworm payloads, all of which are packed. Each Hworm payload created a unique mutex (while some SFX files delivered the same Hworm payload). All of the samples beaconed to one of three network locations as shown in Figure 3:\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nFigure 3 C2 Infrastructure\n\nWhile prior reports on Hworm have been published, we were unable to identify any report detailing this particular version of Hworm. Some previous versions would embed AutoIT scripts in resource sections of PE files while others would execute obfuscated VBS scripts. Some previous versions of the Hworm implant would embed data in the headers of HTTP requests or POST bodies as a method of command and control. Beacons of that HTTP protocol example are easily recognized by the use of \u2018&lt;|&gt;\u2019 as a delimiter and the URI of the request. This new version of Hworm uses a mixed binary and ASCII protocol over TCP. Figure 4 is a packet capture of the protocol used by Hworm samples in this attack. It includes the string \u201cnew_houdini\u201d, the mutex used by the implant, the name of the user, the operating system version, the version of the implant, and the name of the foreground process:\n\n\n\nFigure 4 Packet capture of new communications protocol\n\nDuring the investigation of this malware a forum post on dev-point[.]com, an Arabic speaking technology and security forum, by a user with the handle \u201cHoudini\u201d, outlined plans for a rewrite of a backdoor in Delphi. This post occurred around July 2015.\n\nAround October 2015, a password protected beta version of the builder used to create Delphi Hworm implants (a4c71f862757e3535b305a14ff9f268e6cf196b2e54b426f25fa65bf658a9242) was uploaded to VirusTotal. Unfortunately, the builder used to create the samples outlined in the above attack was not located. Unit 42 believes the samples used in the above attack are a version which were released after the beta.\nAnalyzing the Hworm Malcode:\nUpon configuring and building a server, the builder prompts the user to save a VBS file and modifies a stub file to create the implant. The VBS file is used to load and inject the implant. It appears that the operators behind the above attack either chose to not use the VBS loader or the newer versions of the builder no longer produce a VBS script.\nThe VBS Loader:\nThe script contains three files encoded in base64. The first file is DynamicWrapperX (DCOM_DATA), the second file is the RunPE shellcode (LOADER_DATA), and the third file is the file which gets injected into host process (FILE_DATA). DynamicWrapperX provides access to all Windows APIs from a Visual Basic Script providing a wide range of functionality to this VBS script.\n\nThe configuration of the script is at the beginning of the file (Figure 5).\n\n\n\nFigure 5 Script configuration section\n\nIn the above example, the script will use the registry as a startup method, it will drop itself into the system\u2019s %appdata% directory using the filename myhworm.exe and it will inject itself into svchost.exe.\n\nAs the script executes it first adds one of three startup methods which will execute the script on Windows startup:\nRegistry Run in HKCU\n\nPath: HKCU\\Software\\Microsoft\\Windows\\CurrentVersion\\Run\n\nEntryData Wscript.exe \/\/b \/\/e:vbscript &lt;filepath&gt;\n\/b Specifies batch mode, which does not display alerts, scripting errors, or \ninput prompts.\n\/e Specifies the engine that is used to run the script.\nDefine startup directory\n\tStartup task (not implemented yet)\n\nFollowing the installation of persistence, the script checks if the current environment is WOW64. If so, the script will execute:\n%windir%\\syswow64\\wscript.exe \/b \/e:vbscript &lt;filepath&gt;\n\nThe script then drops DynamicWrapperX in the configured installation directory with file extension \u201c.bin\u201d.\n&lt;installdir&gt;\\&lt;filename&gt;.bin\n\nIt will then register DynamicWrapperX:\nregsvr32.exe \/I \/S &lt;filename_dynamic_wrapperx&gt;\n\nNext, the script will load the registered object:\n\u201cset DCOM = CreateObject(\"DYNAMICWRAPPERX\")\u201d\n\nIt registers \/load VirtualAlloc and CallWindowProcW as functions which can be directly called in the script using \u201cdcom.VirtualAlloc &lt;arguments&gt;\u201d.\n\nUsing VirtualAlloc it will allocate new memory and copy RunPE shellcode (LOADER_DATA, loader.hex) and the to-be-injected binary (FILE_DATA) into memory.\n\nUsing CallWindowProcW the script will jump to the RunPE shellcode and the shellcode will inject the file (FILE_DATA) into the host process.\u00a0 The host process is by default svchost.exe but for .NET files injection can occur into the file:\n%windir%\\Microsoft.Net\\Framework\\v2.0.50727\\msbuild.exe\n\nFigure 6 shows the main routine of the script:\n\n\n\nFigure 6 Main routine\n\nFigure 7shows a hex dump of LOADER_DATA (RunPE shellcode):\n\n\n\nFigure 7 Hex dump of LOADER_DATA\n\nSimilarities in comments and coding styles between previous versions of the Hworm VBS script and the VBS script provided in this beta builder can be seen in Figure 1. Top is the VBS file from the HTTP version of Hworm, compared with the VBS script produced by the beta builder of Hworm (below).\n\n\n\n\n\nFigure 8 Similarities between HWorm versions\nThe Beta Server:\nThe main server which the builder produces is developed in Delphi and is not encrypted. Unit 42 has seen variants packed with VMProtect and ASPack. In some versions of the Delphi Hworm implants discovered (unpacked beta versions) the settings are stored in the resource section RCData\\\u201cCONFIG\u201d and are in clear text (Figure 9).\n\n\n\nFigure 9 Settings\n\nSome versions also have an unfinished PE spreader in the resource section (a65fd78951590833904bd27783b1032b7cc575220a12c6d6f44cb09061999af3). The spreader will terminate all running processes named \u201csm?rtp.exe\u201d and execute a VBS file using wscript.exe:\n\u201cwscript.exe \/e:vbscript &lt;current directory&gt;\\$RECYCLE.BIN\\u vbs name here\u201d. \n\n\n\nFigure 10 Spreader\n\nThe server exports some unused functions (they all just have RET instruction). We have seen \u201cwrom.exe\u201d and \u201cserver.exe\u201d used as the name in the export table (Figure 11).\n\n\n\nFigure 11 Export table\n\nThe author used the open source library Indy Components for network communication. They also used BTMemoryModule to load DLLs from memory (without saving it on the disc).\n\nThe Hworm implants use a connect-back communication. This means the server (implant) connects back to the client (remotely controlling system). It also has some modules implemented in the server and each module uses its own socket for communication (on the same port defined in the configuration).\nThe following modules provide features of this malware:\n\n\n \tScreenshot: Provides the ability to capture screenshots in JPEG\/BMP formats\n \tKeylogger: Provides the ability to log key strokes\n \tInternet IO: Provides the ability to download and execute files from the internet. It also provides the ability to load the executables via the RunPE technique\n \tFile Manager: Provides the ability to list files and directories, delete, rename, and execute files, and upload or download files via TCP or HTTP\n \tPassword: Provides the ability to steal passwords from Firefox, Opera, and Chrome browsers\n \tMisc: Provides the ability to list processes or modules and kill running processes\n \tUSB Notifier: Provides the ability to notify the controller when a USB device is attached\n \tHoudini Client: Provides the main client, which contains the server\u2019s configuration.\n\nFinal Thoughts:\nThe similarities in coding styles and features of the server, as well as languages and handles used by the author of the malware, lead us to believe the beta builder is a version of Hworm which was created somewhere between the HTTP version and the version used in the above outlined attack.\n\nAs this RAT can be found online in semi-public locations it is possible the malware is used by both surgical threat actors as well as within casual compromises. The above attack is only one such campaign Unit 42 has discovered using the Delphi versions of Hworm.\n\nPalo Alto Networks customers can use AutoFocus to find all versions of Hworm samples using the \u201cHworm\u201d tag.\nIndicators:\nDelphi Hworm Beta Builder\na4c71f862757e3535b305a14ff9f268e6cf196b2e54b426f25fa65bf658a9242\n\nDelivery Files\n70c55fef53fd4bdeb135ed68a7eead45e8d4ba7d17e0fd907e9770b2793b60ed\n9af85e46344dadf1467c71d66865c7af98a23151025e7d8993bd9afc5150ad7d\n773716bc2d313e17326471289a0b552f90086a2687fa958ef8cdb611cbc9a8c9\ne0db0982c437c40ceb67970e0a776e9448f428e919200b5f7a0566c58680070c\n1f45e5eca8f8882481b13fd4a67ffa88a1aa4d6e875a9c2e1fbf0b80e92d9588\n5e42e61340942fc0c46a6668a7f54adbbb4792b01c819bcd3047e855116ae16f\nfec925721b6563fec32d7a4cf8df777c647f0e24454fa783569f65cdadff9e03\n106934ff7f6f93a371a4561fff23d69e6783512c38126fbd427ed4a886ca6e65\nba739f3f415efe005fbed6fcfcb1e6d3b3ae64e9a8d2b0566ab913f73530887c\n0672e47513aefcbc3f7a9bd50849acf507a5454bc8c36580304105479c58772a\n\nPayloads\n386057a265619c43ef245857b66241a66822061ce9bd047556c4f3f1d262ef36\n44b52baf2ecef2f928a13b17ba3a5552c32ca4a640e6421b8bc35ef5a113801b\n8428857b0c7dfe43cf2182dd585dfdfd845697a11c31e91d909dc400222b4f78\nd69e0456ddb11b979bf303b8bb9f87322bd2a9542dd9d9f716100c40bd6decd1\nbd5d64234e1ac87955f1d86ee1af34bd8fd11e8edf3a449181234bb62816acab\n774501f3c88ebdd409ec318d08af2350ec37fdbc11f32681f855e215e75440d7\nc66b9e8aaa2ac4ce5b53b45ebb661ba7946f5b82e75865ae9e98510caff911a7\n\nDecoy files\n7916ca6ae6fdbfb45448f6dcff374d072d988d11aa15247a88167bf973ee2c0d\n947d264a413f3353c43dafa0fd918bec75e8752a953b50843bc8134286d6f93f\n9ddf2f2e6ac7da61c04c03f3f27af12cb85e096746f120235724a4ed93fac5aa\n3d287cce7fe1caa5c033a4e6b94680c90a25cb3866837266130ba0fd8fab562c\n444b82caf3c17ea74034c984aeca0f5b2e6547af88a0fb15953f2d5b80e3b448\n3d3db84b6ad760540f638713e3f6a8daf8a226bd045351bcc72c6d22a7df8b3a\nfffda1e2d794a5645f973900083a88ef38c3d20a89c5e59ca21412806db28197\n\nCommand and Control Network Locations\nstart.loginto[.]me\nsamah.sytes[.]net\n52.42.161[.]75\n78.47.96[.]17\n136.243.104[.]200","publisher":{"@type":"Organization","@id":"#panworg"},"image":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https:\/\/unit42.paloaltonetworks.com\/wp-content\/uploads\/2016\/09\/unit42-web-banner-650x300-300x300.jpg","width":300,"height":300},"speakable":{"@type":"SpeakableSpecification","xPath":["\/html\/head\/title","\/html\/head\/meta[@name='description']\/@content"]},"author":[{"@type":"Person","name":"Anthony Kasza"}]}</script><link rel='stylesheet' id='crayon-css' href='https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/plugins/crayon-syntax-highlighter/css/min/crayon.min.css?ver=_2.7.2_beta' media='all' />

<style id='global-styles-inline-css'>
:root{--wp--preset--aspect-ratio--square: 1;--wp--preset--aspect-ratio--4-3: 4/3;--wp--preset--aspect-ratio--3-4: 3/4;--wp--preset--aspect-ratio--3-2: 3/2;--wp--preset--aspect-ratio--2-3:     <script type="text/javascript">
    ;(function(win, doc, style, timeout) {
    var STYLE_ID = 'at-body-style';
    function getParent() {
    return doc.getElementsByTagName('head')[0];
    }
    function addStyle(parent, id, def) {
        if (!parent) {
        return;
        }
        var style = doc.createElement('style');
        style.id = id;
        style.innerHTML = def;
        parent.appendChild(style);
    }
    function removeStyle(parent, id) {
        if (!parent) {
            return;
        }
        var style = doc.getElementById(id);
        if (!style) {
            return;
        }
        parent.removeChild(style);
    }
    addStyle(getParent(), STYLE_ID, style);
    setTimeout(function() {
    removeStyle(getParent(), STYLE_ID);
    }, timeout);
    }(window, document, "body {visibility:hidden !important}", 3000));
    </script>

<script type="text/javascript">
var isIE11 = !!navigator.userAgent.match(/Trident.*rv\:11\./);
if(isIE11){
    var polyfill = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/dist/scripts/polyfill.min.js';
    document.write('<script type="text/javascript" src="'+polyfill+'">\x3C/script>');
}
    /**
 * String.prototype.replaceAll() polyfill
 * https://gomakethings.com/how-to-replace-a-section-of-a-string-with-another-one-with-vanilla-js/
 * @author Chris Ferdinandi
 * @license MIT
 */
if (!String.prototype.replaceAll) {
	String.prototype.replaceAll = function(str, newStr){
		// If a regex pattern
		if (Object.prototype.toString.call(str).toLowerCase() === '[object regexp]') {
			return this.replace(str, newStr);
		}
		// If a string
		return this.replace(new RegExp(str, 'g'), newStr);
	};
}

    /*! lozad.js - v1.16.0 - 2020-09-06 */
!function(t,e){"object"==typeof exports&&"undefined"!=typeof module?module.exports=e():"function"==typeof define&&define.amd?define(e):t.lozad=e()}(this,function(){"use strict";
/**
   * Detect IE browser
   * @const {boolean}
   * @private
   */var g="undefined"!=typeof document&&document.documentMode,f={rootMargin:"0px",threshold:0,load:function(t){if("picture"===t.nodeName.toLowerCase()){var e=t.querySelector("img"),r=!1;null===e&&(e=document.createElement("img"),r=!0),g&&t.getAttribute("data-iesrc")&&(e.src=t.getAttribute("data-iesrc")),t.getAttribute("data-alt")&&(e.alt=t.getAttribute("data-alt")),r&&t.append(e)}if("video"===t.nodeName.toLowerCase()&&!t.getAttribute("data-src")&&t.children){for(var a=t.children,o=void 0,i=0;i<=a.length-1;i++)(o=a[i].getAttribute("data-src"))&&(a[i].src=o);t.load()}t.getAttribute("data-poster")&&(t.poster=t.getAttribute("data-poster")),t.getAttribute("data-src")&&(t.src=t.getAttribute("data-src")),t.getAttribute("data-srcset")&&t.setAttribute("srcset",t.getAttribute("data-srcset"));var n=",";if(t.getAttribute("data-background-delimiter")&&(n=t.getAttribute("data-background-delimiter")),t.getAttribute("data-background-image"))t.style.backgroundImage="url('"+t.getAttribute("data-background-image").split(n).join("'),url('")+"')";else if(t.getAttribute("data-background-image-set")){var d=t.getAttribute("data-background-image-set").split(n),u=d[0].substr(0,d[0].indexOf(" "))||d[0];// Substring before ... 1x
u=-1===u.indexOf("url(")?"url("+u+")":u,1===d.length?t.style.backgroundImage=u:t.setAttribute("style",(t.getAttribute("style")||"")+"background-image: "+u+"; background-image: -webkit-image-set("+d+"); background-image: image-set("+d+")")}t.getAttribute("data-toggle-class")&&t.classList.toggle(t.getAttribute("data-toggle-class"))},loaded:function(){}};function A(t){t.setAttribute("data-loaded",!0)}var m=function(t){return"true"===t.getAttribute("data-loaded")},v=function(t){var e=1<arguments.length&&void 0!==arguments[1]?arguments[1]:document;return t instanceof Element?[t]:t instanceof NodeList?t:e.querySelectorAll(t)};return function(){var r,a,o=0<arguments.length&&void 0!==arguments[0]?arguments[0]:".lozad",t=1<arguments.length&&void 0!==arguments[1]?arguments[1]:{},e=Object.assign({},f,t),i=e.root,n=e.rootMargin,d=e.threshold,u=e.load,g=e.loaded,s=void 0;"undefined"!=typeof window&&window.IntersectionObserver&&(s=new IntersectionObserver((r=u,a=g,function(t,e){t.forEach(function(t){(0<t.intersectionRatio||t.isIntersecting)&&(e.unobserve(t.target),m(t.target)||(r(t.target),A(t.target),a(t.target)))})}),{root:i,rootMargin:n,threshold:d}));for(var c,l=v(o,i),b=0;b<l.length;b++)(c=l[b]).getAttribute("data-placeholder-background")&&(c.style.background=c.getAttribute("data-placeholder-background"));return{observe:function(){for(var t=v(o,i),e=0;e<t.length;e++)m(t[e])||(s?s.observe(t[e]):(u(t[e]),A(t[e]),g(t[e])))},triggerLoad:function(t){m(t)||(u(t),A(t),g(t))},observer:s}}});

</script>

    </head>
<body class="post-template-default single single-post postid-21294 single-format-standard no-sidebar">
<header class="haeder py-15 position-relative z-index-2" style="display: none;">
  <div class="container px-sm-30 px-35">
    <div class="row">
        <div class="first-logo col-sm-auto col-6 mb-sm-0 mb-40 text-sm-center order-1">
                        <a href="https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/">
                <img src="/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/PANW_Parent.png" width="140px" alt="Logo" />

        </div>
      <div class="col-sm-auto col-6 text-sm-center order-sm-2 order-4 second-logo-unit">
        <a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/">
            <img src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/dist/images/unit42-logo-white.svg" class="attachment-full size-full" alt="Unit42 Logo"  width="150" height="35"/>
        </a>
      </div>

      <div class="col-auto d-sm-none ml-auto mb-40 order-2">
        <button class="btn__search" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#search" aria-label="search"><i class="ui ui-1"></i></button>
      </div>

      <div id="search" class="collapse d-sm-block col-sm-auto col-12 ml-auto order-3">
        <div class="pt-sm-0 pt-20 pb-sm-0 pb-40 mt-sm-0 mt-n30">
                      <input type="search" placeholder="Search Unit 42" id="innerSearch" class="header__search" value="" required aria-label="Inner Search">
                  </div>
      </div>

      <div class="col-auto d-sm-none d-flex ml-auto align-items-center order-5">
        <button class="btn__menu rounded" data-toggle="collapse" data-target="#navigation">Menu</button>
      </div>
    </div>
  </div>
</header>

<nav id="navigation" class="site-nav collapse d-sm-block pb-20 mt-sm-10"  style="display: none!important;">
  <div class="container px-sm-30">
    <ul id="menu-primary-navigation" class="main-menu d-sm-flex font-weight-medium"><li id="menu-item-97290" class="menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page menu-item-97290"><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/tools/">Tools</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-41" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-41"><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/atoms/">ATOMs</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-119884" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-119884"><a target="_blank" href="https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/unit42">Security Consulting</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-81229" class="menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page menu-item-81229"><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/about-unit-42/">About Us</a></li>
<li id="menu-item-121229" class="menu-item menu-item-type-custom menu-item-object-custom menu-item-121229"><a href="https://start.paloaltonetworks.com/contact-unit42.html"><b style="color:#C84727">Under Attack?</b></a></li>
</ul>  </div>

<div class="panClean pan-template-home" id="main-nav-menu-cont" style="display:none;">
    <div class="cleanHeader mainNavigationComp baseComponent parbase">
        <div class="productNav2021Component dark default" id="PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC">
        </div>
  </div>
<div class="cleanTopHtml htmlComp baseComponent parbase"><div class="base-component-spacer spacer-none  "></div>
</div>

<!--  Start: Scripts Migrated From Unit42-v5 -->
<script type="text/javascript">
	function getCookie(cname) {
	 	var name = cname + "=";
  		var decodedCookie = decodeURIComponent(document.cookie);
		var ca = decodedCookie.split(';');
  		for(var i = 0; i <ca.length; i++) {
    			var c = ca[i];
    			while (c.charAt(0) == ' ') {
     				 c = c.substring(1);
    			}
    			if (c.indexOf(name) == 0) {
    				 return c.substring(name.length, c.length);
    			}
  		}
  		return "";
	}

	var referer = "";//sessionStorage.container;
	var pcontainer = sessionStorage.getItem("container");
	var searchResultsPagePath = "";
	if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Prisma')!=-1)){
	    referer = 'Prisma' ;
	}        
        else if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Cortex')!=-1)){
            if( pcontainer.indexOf('CloudCortex') != -1){
                referer = 'CloudCortex' ;
            }
            else{
                referer = 'Cortex' ;
            }	    
	}
        else if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Sase')!=-1)){
	    referer = 'Sase' ;
	}
	else if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Unit')!=-1)){
	    referer = 'Unit' ;
	}
	else if(((pcontainer) && pcontainer.indexOf('Ngfw')!=-1)){
	    referer = 'Ngfw' ;
	}
        var fromRef = document.referrer;
        var nContainer = getCookie("navContainer");
        if(nContainer){//If user is coming from main site, we need to reset the container		
		if(fromRef  && fromRef.indexOf("prismacloud.io")!=-1){
                        referer = 'Prisma' ;
                        sessionStorage.setItem("container","Prisma");
                } else if(fromRef.indexOf("paloaltonetworks.com")!=-1 || fromRef.indexOf("paloaltonetworks.jp")!=-1 ){
                        if(nContainer.indexOf('Prisma') != -1){
                            referer = 'Prisma' ;
                            sessionStorage.setItem("container","Prisma");
                        }
                        if(nContainer.indexOf('Cortex') != -1){
                            if( nContainer.indexOf('CloudCortex') != -1){
                                referer = 'CloudCortex';
                                sessionStorage.setItem("container","CloudCortex");
                            }
                            else{
                                referer = 'Cortex';
                                sessionStorage.setItem("container","Cortex");
                            }                            
                        }
			if(nContainer.indexOf('Sase') != -1){
                            referer = 'Sase' ;
                            sessionStorage.setItem("container","Sase");
                        }
			if(nContainer.indexOf('Unit') != -1){
                            referer = 'Unit' ;
                            sessionStorage.setItem("container","Unit");
                        }
			if(nContainer.indexOf('Ngfw') != -1){
                            referer = 'Ngfw' ;
                            sessionStorage.setItem("container","Ngfw");
                        }
			document.cookie = 'navContainer=; path=/; domain=.paloaltonetworks.com; expires=' + new Date(0).toUTCString();
		}
	}
if(referer != "Prisma" && referer != "CloudCortex" && referer != "Cortex" && referer != "Sase" && referer != "Unit" && referer != "Ngfw") {
    referer = 'Unit' ;
    sessionStorage.setItem("container","Unit");
}
function callMainSitePrismaNavHTML(){
    
    var referrer_domain = 'https://www.paloaltonetworks.com';
    sessionStorage.setItem("domain",referrer_domain);
    if(referer == 'Prisma'){
        //var menu_url = referrer_domain+'/_jcr_content/globals/cleanHeaderPrisma.prismaRenderer.html';
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php?type=prisma&domain=en';
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/search/prismasearch";
        }
    if(referer == 'CloudCortex'){
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php?type=cortexcloud&domain=en';
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/search/cortexcloudsearch";	
    }
    if(referer == 'Cortex'){
        //var menu_url = referrer_domain+'/_jcr_content/globals/cleanHeaderCortex.cortexRenderer.html';	
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php?type=cortex&domain=en';	
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/search/cortexsearch";	
    }
    if(referer == 'Sase'){
        //var menu_url = referrer_domain+'/_jcr_content/globals/cleanHeaderSase.saseRenderer.html';
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php?type=sase&domain=en';
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/search/sasesearch";
    }
    if(referer == 'Unit'){
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php?type=unit42&domain=en';
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/content/pan/en_US/search/unit42search";
		    }
    if(referer == 'Ngfw'){
        //var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/ngfw-cdss-nav-renderer.php';
        var menu_url = 'https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/themes/unit42-v6/unit-nav-renderer.php?type=ngfw&domain=en'; 
        searchResultsPagePath = referrer_domain+"/search/ngfwcdsssearch";
    }
    httpGet(menu_url,'menu_html');
    document.getElementById('main-nav-menu-cont').removeAttribute("style");
}
function addStyle(styles) {            
    /* Create style document */
    var css = document.createElement('style');
    css.type = 'text/css';

    if (css.styleSheet) 
        css.styleSheet.cssText = styles;
    else 
        css.appendChild(document.createTextNode(styles));

    /* Append style to the tag name */
    document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0].appendChild(css);
}
function httpGet(theUrl,req_type) {
    if (window.XMLHttpRequest) { // code for IE7+, Firefox, Chrome, Opera, Safari
        xmlhttp=new XMLHttpRequest();
    } else {// code for IE6, IE5
        xmlhttp=new ActiveXObject("Microsoft.XMLHTTP");
    }
    xmlhttp.onreadystatechange=function()
    {
        if (xmlhttp.readyState==4 && xmlhttp.status==200)
        {
            if(req_type == 'menu_html'){
            var nav_text = xmlhttp.responseText.replaceAll('https://static.cloud.coveo.com/searchui/v2.9159/js/CoveoJsSearch.Lazy.min.js', '');
            nav_text = nav_text.replaceAll('src="/', 'src="'+maindomain_lang+'/');
            nav_text = nav_text.replaceAll("'/content", "'"+maindomain_lang+"/content");
                        
            document.getElementById("PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC").innerHTML = nav_text.replaceAll('href="/', 'href="'+maindomain_lang+'/');

            var lozad_back = document.getElementsByClassName('lozad-background');
            Array.prototype.forEach.call(lozad_back, function(el) {
            // Do stuff here
            var el_back_img_path = el.getAttribute('data-background-image');
            var first_pos = el_back_img_path.indexOf("'");
            var last_pos = el_back_img_path.indexOf("'",first_pos+1);
            el_back_img_path = el_back_img_path.substring(first_pos+1,last_pos);
            el.setAttribute("data-background-image",main_site_url+el_back_img_path);
            });
            const observer_lozad = lozad('.lozad, .lozad-background'); // lazy loads elements with default selector as '.lozad'
            observer_lozad.observe();
            }
            if(req_type == 'head_inline_css'){
            addStyle(xmlhttp.responseText);
            }
        }
    }
    xmlhttp.open("GET", theUrl, true );
    xmlhttp.send();    
}    
    
if(referer == 'Prisma' || referer == 'CloudCortex' || referer == 'Cortex' || referer == 'Sase' || referer == 'Unit' || referer == 'Ngfw'){
    const article = document.querySelector('#PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC');
    if(referer == 'Prisma'){
        article.dataset.type = 'prisma';
        $('#PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC').removeClass('default').addClass('defaultRedesigned');
    }
    else if(referer == 'CloudCortex'){
        article.dataset.type = 'cloudcortex';
    }
    else if(referer == 'Cortex'){
        article.dataset.type = 'cortex';
    }
    else if(referer == 'Sase'){
        article.dataset.type = 'sase';
    }
    else if(referer == 'Unit'){
        article.dataset.type = 'unit';
    }
    else if(referer == 'Ngfw'){
        article.dataset.type = 'ngfw';
    }
    //set class to default
    if(referer == 'Unit' || referer == 'Ngfw'){
        $('#PAN_2021_NAV_ASYNC').removeClass('default').addClass('defaultRedesigned');
    }
    callMainSitePrismaNavHTML();
}
</script>
<!--  End: Scripts Migrated From Unit42-v5 -->

      </section> 
    <section class="section blog-contents"> 
      <div class="pa blog-editor">
        <div class="l-container">
          <div class="be__wrapper">
            <div class="be__contents">
              <div class="be__contents-wrapper">
                <p>Unit 42 has observed a new version of Hworm (or Houdini) being used within multiple attacks. This blog outlines technical details of this new Hworm version and documents an attack campaign making use of the backdoor. Of the samples used in this attack, the first we observed were June 2016, while as-of publication we were still seeing attacks as recently as mid-October, suggesting that this is likely an active, ongoing campaign.</p>
<h3>Deconstructing the Threats:</h3>
<p>The investigation into this malware began while searching through <a href="https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/products/secure-the-network/subscriptions/wildfire">WildFire</a> execution reports within <a href="https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/products/secure-the-network/subscriptions/autofocus">AutoFocus</a>. Looking for newly submitted malicious samples with no family label, a unique mutex surfaced, “RCSTEST”. Pivoting around the creation of this mutex, as well as other dynamic behaviors, a group of samples slowly began to emerge. The group of samples has common delivery mechanisms, lures and decoy file themes, payloads (Hworm), as well as control infrastructure.</p>
<p>Samples from this attack came in the form of SFX files. The original filenames of these delivery files are related to political figures and groups in the Middle East and the Mediterranean. They include:</p>
<p style="padding-left: 30px;">Mohamed Dahlan Abu Dhabi Meeting.exe<br />
فضيحة من العيار الثقيل اردوغان يشرب الخمر.exe<br />
صراعات داخلية في صفوف الاخوان المسلمين.exe<br />
عملية اغتيال الدكتور محمد كمال.scr<br />
الملك عبد الله يهدد دول الخليج ويتوعد دحلان.exe<br />
بالفيديو امير سعودي يهين مواطنين على الهواء.scr</p>
<p>When executed each SFX file opens a decoy document, video, or URL, and eventually executes an Hworm payload in the background. The decoy files are similarly themed when compared to the above delivery file names. Figure 1 shows a screenshot from a video one sample opens as a decoy.</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_1.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-21336 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_1.png" alt="houdini_1" width="687" height="617" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_1.png 687w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_1-300x269.png 300w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_1-370x332.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 687px) 100vw, 687px" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align: left;"><em>Figure 1 Decoy video</em></p>
<p>Another sample displays a YouTube video by dropping a .url shortcut and opening it using the system’s default web browser. Figure 2 illustrates the .url file contents:</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_2.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-21333 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_2.png" alt="houdini_2" width="662" height="184" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_2.png 662w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_2-300x83.png 300w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_2-370x103.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 662px) 100vw, 662px" /></a></p>
<p><em>Figure 2 .url file</em></p>
<p>When the .url file is opened, the above YouTube video is displayed as a decoy. It is unclear at this time if the uploader of this video has any relation to this particular attack</p>
<p>Besides decoys, the samples also execute Hworm payloads, all of which are packed. Each Hworm payload created a unique mutex (while some SFX files delivered the same Hworm payload). All of the samples beaconed to one of three network locations as shown in Figure 3:</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_3.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-21330 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_3.png" alt="houdini_3" width="964" height="464" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_3.png 964w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_3-380x184.png 380w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_3-900x433.png 900w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_3-300x144.png 300w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_3-768x370.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_3-370x178.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 964px) 100vw, 964px" /></a></p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_4.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-21327 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_4.png" alt="houdini_4" width="969" height="527" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_4.png 969w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_4-900x489.png 900w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_4-300x163.png 300w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_4-768x418.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_4-370x201.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 969px) 100vw, 969px" /></a></p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_5.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-21324 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_5.png" alt="houdini_5" width="426" height="312" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_5.png 426w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_5-300x220.png 300w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_5-370x271.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 426px) 100vw, 426px" /></a></p>
<p><em>Figure 3 C2 Infrastructure</em></p>
<p>While prior reports on Hworm have been <a href="https://www.fireeye.com/blog/threat-research/2013/09/now-you-see-me-h-worm-by-houdini.html">published</a>, we were unable to identify any report detailing this particular version of Hworm. Some previous versions would embed AutoIT scripts in resource sections of PE files while others would execute obfuscated VBS scripts. Some previous versions of the Hworm implant would embed data in the headers of HTTP requests or POST bodies as a method of command and control. Beacons of that HTTP protocol example are easily recognized by the use of ‘&lt;|&gt;’ as a delimiter and the URI of the request. This new version of Hworm uses a mixed binary and ASCII protocol over TCP. Figure 4 is a packet capture of the protocol used by Hworm samples in this attack. It includes the string “new_houdini”, the mutex used by the implant, the name of the user, the operating system version, the version of the implant, and the name of the foreground process:</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_6.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-21321 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_6.png" alt="houdini_6" width="730" height="469" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_6.png 730w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_6-300x193.png 300w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_6-370x238.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 730px) 100vw, 730px" /></a></p>
<p><em>Figure 4 Packet capture of new communications protocol</em></p>
<p>During the investigation of this malware a forum post on dev-point[.]com, an Arabic speaking technology and security forum, by a user with the handle “Houdini”, outlined plans for a rewrite of a backdoor in Delphi. This post occurred around July 2015.</p>
<p>Around October 2015, a password protected beta version of the builder used to create Delphi Hworm implants (a4c71f862757e3535b305a14ff9f268e6cf196b2e54b426f25fa65bf658a9242) was uploaded to VirusTotal. Unfortunately, the builder used to create the samples outlined in the above attack was not located. Unit 42 believes the samples used in the above attack are a version which were released after the beta.</p>
<h3>Analyzing the Hworm Malcode:</h3>
<p>Upon configuring and building a server, the builder prompts the user to save a VBS file and modifies a stub file to create the implant. The VBS file is used to load and inject the implant. It appears that the operators behind the above attack either chose to not use the VBS loader or the newer versions of the builder no longer produce a VBS script.</p>
<h4>The VBS Loader:</h4>
<p>The script contains three files encoded in base64. The first file is <a href="https://www.script-coding.com/dynwrapx_eng.html">DynamicWrapperX</a> (DCOM_DATA), the second file is the RunPE shellcode (LOADER_DATA), and the third file is the file which gets injected into host process (FILE_DATA). DynamicWrapperX provides access to all Windows APIs from a Visual Basic Script providing a wide range of functionality to this VBS script.</p>
<p>The configuration of the script is at the beginning of the file (Figure 5).</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_7.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-21318 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_7.png" alt="houdini_7" width="458" height="331" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_7.png 458w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_7-300x217.png 300w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_7-370x267.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 458px) 100vw, 458px" /></a></p>
<p><em>Figure 5 Script configuration section</em></p>
<p>In the above example, the script will use the registry as a startup method, it will drop itself into the system’s %appdata% directory using the filename myhworm.exe and it will inject itself into svchost.exe.</p>
<p>As the script executes it first adds one of three startup methods which will execute the script on Windows startup:</p><!-- Crayon Syntax Highlighter v_2.7.2_beta -->

		<div id="crayon-682e875f1db77980400554" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-classic crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover wrap" style=" margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
		
			<div class="crayon-toolbar" data-settings=" mouseover overlay hide delay" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><span class="crayon-title"></span>
			<div class="crayon-tools" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><div class="crayon-button crayon-nums-button" title="Toggle Line Numbers"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-plain-button" title="Toggle Plain Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-wrap-button" title="Toggle Line Wrap"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-expand-button" title="Expand Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-copy-button" title="Copy"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-popup-button" title="Open Code In New Window"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div></div></div>
			<div class="crayon-info" style="min-height: 16.8px !important; line-height: 16.8px !important;"></div>
			<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea  class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly style="-moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
Registry Run in HKCU

Path: HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run

EntryData Wscript.exe //b //e:vbscript &lt;filepath&gt;
/b Specifies batch mode, which does not display alerts, scripting errors, or 
input prompts.
/e Specifies the engine that is used to run the script.
Define startup directory
	Startup task (not implemented yet)</textarea></div>
			<div class="crayon-main" style="">
				<table class="crayon-table">
					<tr class="crayon-row">
				<td class="crayon-nums " data-settings="show">

				</td>
						<td class="crayon-code"><div class="crayon-pre" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important; -moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4;"><div class="crayon-e">HKCU</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-682e875f1db77980400554-2">&nbsp;</div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-682e875f1db77980400554-3"><span id="crayon-682e875f1db77980400554-4">&nbsp;</div><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-682e875f1db77980400554-5"><span class="crayon-e">EntryData </span><span class="crayon-i">Wscript</span><span class="crayon-sy">.</span><span class="crayon-i">exe</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-c">//b //e:vbscript &lt;filepath&gt;</span></div><div class="crayon-line class="crayon-st">not</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">display </span><span class="crayon-i">alerts</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">scripting </span><span class="crayon-i">errors</span><span class="crayon-sy">,</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-st">or</span><span </span><span class="crayon-e">used </span><span class="crayon-st">to</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">run </span><span class="crayon-e">the </span><span </span><span class="crayon-e">directory</span></div><div class="crayon-line crayon-striped-line" id="crayon-682e875f1db77980400554-10"><span class="crayon-e">	</span><span class="crayon-e">Startup </span><span class="crayon-e">task</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-st">not</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span 					</tr>
				</table>
			</div>
		</div>
<!-- [Format Time: 0.0002 seconds] -->
<p>Following the installation of persistence, the script checks if the current environment is WOW64. If so, the script will execute:</p><!-- Crayon Syntax Highlighter v_2.7.2_beta -->

		<div id="crayon-682e875f1db82538617865" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-classic crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover wrap" style=" margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
		
			<div class="crayon-toolbar" data-settings=" mouseover overlay hide delay" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><span class="crayon-title"></span>
			<div class="crayon-tools" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><div class="crayon-button crayon-nums-button" title="Toggle Line Numbers"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-plain-button" title="Toggle Plain Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-wrap-button" title="Toggle Line Wrap"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-expand-button" title="Expand Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-copy-button" title="Copy"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-popup-button" title="Open Code In New Window"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div></div></div>
			<div class="crayon-info" style="min-height: 16.8px !important; line-height: 16.8px !important;"></div>
			<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea  class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly style="-moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
%windir%\syswow64\wscript.exe /b /e:vbscript &lt;filepath&gt;</textarea></div>
			<div class="crayon-main" style="">
				<table class="crayon-table">
					<tr class="crayon-row">
				<td class="crayon-nums " data-settings="show">
					<div class="crayon-nums-content" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;"><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-682e875f1db82538617865-1">1</div></div>
				</td>
						<td class="crayon-code"><div class="crayon-pre" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important; -moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4;"><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-682e875f1db82538617865-1"><span class="crayon-sy">%</span><span class="crayon-i">windir</span><span class="crayon-sy">%</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-i">syswow64</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-i">wscript</span><span class="crayon-sy">.</span><span class="crayon-i">exe</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>/<span class="crayon-i">b</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>/<span class="crayon-i">e</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span><span class="crayon-i">vbscript</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-i">filepath</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span></div></div></td>
					</tr>
				</table>
			</div>
		</div>
<!-- [Format Time: 0.0001 seconds] -->
<p>The script then drops DynamicWrapperX in the configured installation directory with file extension “.bin”.</p><!-- Crayon Syntax Highlighter v_2.7.2_beta -->

		<div id="crayon-682e875f1db86434263993" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-classic crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover wrap" style=" margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
		
			<div class="crayon-toolbar" data-settings=" mouseover overlay hide delay" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><span class="crayon-title"></span>
			<div class="crayon-tools" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><div class="crayon-button crayon-nums-button" title="Toggle Line Numbers"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-plain-button" title="Toggle Plain Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-wrap-button" title="Toggle Line Wrap"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-expand-button" title="Expand Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-copy-button" title="Copy"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-popup-button" title="Open Code In New Window"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div></div></div>
			<div class="crayon-info" style="min-height: 16.8px !important; line-height: 16.8px !important;"></div>
			<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea  class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly style="-moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
&lt;installdir&gt;\&lt;filename&gt;.bin</textarea></div>
			<div class="crayon-main" style="">
				<table class="crayon-table">
					<tr class="crayon-row">
				<td class="crayon-nums " data-settings="show">
					<div class="crayon-nums-content" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;"><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-682e875f1db86434263993-1">1</div></div>
				</td>
						<td class="crayon-code"><div class="crayon-pre" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important; -moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4;"><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-682e875f1db86434263993-1"><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-i">installdir</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-i">filename</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-sy">.</span><span class="crayon-i">bin</span></div></div></td>
					</tr>
				</table>
			</div>
		</div>
<!-- [Format Time: 0.0000 seconds] -->
<p>It will then register DynamicWrapperX:</p><!-- Crayon Syntax Highlighter v_2.7.2_beta -->

		<div id="crayon-682e875f1db88510007046" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-classic crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover wrap" style=" margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
		
			<div class="crayon-toolbar" data-settings=" mouseover overlay hide delay" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><span class="crayon-title"></span>
			<div class="crayon-tools" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><div class="crayon-button crayon-nums-button" title="Toggle Line Numbers"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-plain-button" title="Toggle Plain Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-wrap-button" title="Toggle Line Wrap"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-expand-button" title="Expand Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-copy-button" title="Copy"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-popup-button" title="Open Code In New Window"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div></div></div>
			<div class="crayon-info" style="min-height: 16.8px !important; line-height: 16.8px !important;"></div>
			<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea  class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly style="-moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
regsvr32.exe /I /S &lt;filename_dynamic_wrapperx&gt;</textarea></div>
			<div class="crayon-main" style="">
				<table class="crayon-table">
					<tr class="crayon-row">
				<td class="crayon-nums " data-settings="show">
					<div class="crayon-nums-content" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;"><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-682e875f1db88510007046-1">1</div></div>
				</td>
						<td class="crayon-code"><div class="crayon-pre" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important; -moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4;"><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-682e875f1db88510007046-1"><span class="crayon-i">regsvr32</span><span class="crayon-sy">.</span><span class="crayon-i">exe</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>/<span class="crayon-i">I</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>/<span class="crayon-i">S</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-i">filename_dynamic_wrapperx</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span></div></div></td>
					</tr>
				</table>
			</div>
		</div>
<!-- [Format Time: 0.0001 seconds] -->
<p>Next, the script will load the registered object:</p><!-- Crayon Syntax Highlighter v_2.7.2_beta -->

		<div id="crayon-682e875f1db89381728208" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-classic crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover wrap" style=" margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
		
			<div class="crayon-toolbar" data-settings=" mouseover overlay hide delay" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><span class="crayon-title"></span>
			<div class="crayon-tools" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><div class="crayon-button crayon-nums-button" title="Toggle Line Numbers"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-plain-button" title="Toggle Plain Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-wrap-button" title="Toggle Line Wrap"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-expand-button" title="Expand Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-copy-button" title="Copy"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-popup-button" title="Open Code In New Window"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div></div></div>
			<div class="crayon-info" style="min-height: 16.8px !important; line-height: 16.8px !important;"></div>
			<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea  class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly style="-moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
“set DCOM = CreateObject("DYNAMICWRAPPERX")”</textarea></div>
			<div class="crayon-main" style="">
				<table class="crayon-table">
					<tr class="crayon-row">
				<td class="crayon-nums " data-settings="show">
					<div class="crayon-nums-content" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;"><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-682e875f1db89381728208-1">1</div></div>
				</td>
						<td class="crayon-code"><div class="crayon-pre" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important; -moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4;"><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-682e875f1db89381728208-1">“<span class="crayon-e">set </span><span class="crayon-i">DCOM</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>=<span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">CreateObject</span><span class="crayon-sy">(</span><span class="crayon-s">"DYNAMICWRAPPERX"</span><span class="crayon-sy">)</span>”</div></div></td>
					</tr>
				</table>
			</div>
		</div>
<!-- [Format Time: 0.0000 seconds] -->
<p>It registers /load VirtualAlloc and CallWindowProcW as functions which can be directly called in the script using “dcom.VirtualAlloc &lt;arguments&gt;”.</p>
<p>Using VirtualAlloc it will allocate new memory and copy RunPE shellcode (LOADER_DATA, loader.hex) and the to-be-injected binary (FILE_DATA) into memory.</p>
<p>Using CallWindowProcW the script will jump to the RunPE shellcode and the shellcode will inject the file (FILE_DATA) into the host process.  The host process is by default svchost.exe but for .NET files injection can occur into the file:</p><!-- Crayon Syntax Highlighter v_2.7.2_beta -->

		<div id="crayon-682e875f1db8b747602391" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-classic crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover wrap" style=" margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
		
			<div class="crayon-toolbar" data-settings=" mouseover overlay hide delay" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><span class="crayon-title"></span>
			<div class="crayon-tools" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><div class="crayon-button crayon-nums-button" title="Toggle Line Numbers"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-plain-button" title="Toggle Plain Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-wrap-button" title="Toggle Line Wrap"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-expand-button" title="Expand Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-copy-button" title="Copy"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-popup-button" title="Open Code In New Window"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div></div></div>
			<div class="crayon-info" style="min-height: 16.8px !important; line-height: 16.8px !important;"></div>
			<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea  class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly style="-moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
%windir%\Microsoft.Net\Framework\v2.0.50727\msbuild.exe</textarea></div>
			<div class="crayon-main" style="">
				<table class="crayon-table">
					<tr class="crayon-row">
				<td class="crayon-nums " data-settings="show">
					<div class="crayon-nums-content" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;"><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-682e875f1db8b747602391-1">1</div></div>
				</td>
						<td class="crayon-code"><div class="crayon-pre" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important; -moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4;"><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-682e875f1db8b747602391-1"><span class="crayon-sy">%</span><span class="crayon-i">windir</span><span class="crayon-sy">%</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-i">Microsoft</span><span class="crayon-sy">.</span><span class="crayon-i">Net</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-i">Framework</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-i">v2</span><span class="crayon-sy">.</span><span class="crayon-cn">0.50727</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-i">msbuild</span><span class="crayon-sy">.</span><span class="crayon-i">exe</span></div></div></td>
					</tr>
				</table>
			</div>
		</div>
<!-- [Format Time: 0.0001 seconds] -->
<p>Figure 6 shows the main routine of the script:</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_8.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-21315 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_8.png" alt="houdini_8" width="900" height="757" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_8.png 900w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_8-300x252.png 300w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_8-768x646.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_8-370x311.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px" /></a></p>
<p><em>Figure 6 Main routine</em></p>
<p>Figure 7shows a hex dump of LOADER_DATA (RunPE shellcode):</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_9.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-21312 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_9.png" alt="houdini_9" width="795" height="400" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_9.png 795w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_9-300x151.png 300w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_9-768x386.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_9-370x186.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 795px) 100vw, 795px" /></a></p>
<p><em>Figure 7 Hex dump of LOADER_DATA</em></p>
<p>Similarities in comments and coding styles between previous versions of the Hworm VBS script and the VBS script provided in this beta builder can be seen in Figure 1. Top is the VBS file from the HTTP version of Hworm, compared with the VBS script produced by the beta builder of Hworm (below).</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_10.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-21309 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_10.png" alt="houdini_10" width="712" height="719" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_10.png 712w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_10-150x150.png 150w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_10-297x300.png 297w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_10-370x374.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 712px) 100vw, 712px" /></a></p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_11.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-21306 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_11.png" alt="houdini_11" width="700" height="424" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_11.png 700w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_11-300x182.png 300w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_11-370x224.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 700px) 100vw, 700px" /></a></p>
<p><em>Figure 8 Similarities between HWorm versions</em></p>
<h4>The Beta Server:</h4>
<p>The main server which the builder produces is developed in Delphi and is not encrypted. Unit 42 has seen variants packed with VMProtect and ASPack. In some versions of the Delphi Hworm implants discovered (unpacked beta versions) the settings are stored in the resource section RCData\“CONFIG” and are in clear text (Figure 9).</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_12.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-21303 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_12.png" alt="houdini_12" width="900" height="495" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_12.png 900w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_12-300x165.png 300w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_12-768x422.png 768w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_12-370x204.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 900px) 100vw, 900px" /></a></p>
<p><em>Figure 9 Settings</em></p>
<p>Some versions also have an unfinished PE spreader in the resource section (a65fd78951590833904bd27783b1032b7cc575220a12c6d6f44cb09061999af3). The spreader will terminate all running processes named “sm?rtp.exe” and execute a VBS file using wscript.exe:</p><!-- Crayon Syntax Highlighter v_2.7.2_beta -->

		<div id="crayon-682e875f1db8c879003368" class="crayon-syntax crayon-theme-classic crayon-font-monaco crayon-os-pc print-yes notranslate" data-settings=" minimize scroll-mouseover wrap" style=" margin-top: 12px; margin-bottom: 12px; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
		
			<div class="crayon-toolbar" data-settings=" mouseover overlay hide delay" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><span class="crayon-title"></span>
			<div class="crayon-tools" style="font-size: 12px !important;height: 18px !important; line-height: 18px !important;"><div class="crayon-button crayon-nums-button" title="Toggle Line Numbers"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-plain-button" title="Toggle Plain Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-wrap-button" title="Toggle Line Wrap"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-expand-button" title="Expand Code"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-copy-button" title="Copy"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div><div class="crayon-button crayon-popup-button" title="Open Code In New Window"><div class="crayon-button-icon"></div></div></div></div>
			<div class="crayon-info" style="min-height: 16.8px !important; line-height: 16.8px !important;"></div>
			<div class="crayon-plain-wrap"><textarea  class="crayon-plain print-no" data-settings="dblclick" readonly style="-moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4; font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;">
“wscript.exe /e:vbscript &lt;current directory&gt;\$RECYCLE.BIN\u vbs name here”. </textarea></div>
			<div class="crayon-main" style="">
				<table class="crayon-table">
					<tr class="crayon-row">
				<td class="crayon-nums " data-settings="show">
					<div class="crayon-nums-content" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important;"><div class="crayon-num" data-line="crayon-682e875f1db8c879003368-1">1</div></div>
				</td>
						<td class="crayon-code"><div class="crayon-pre" style="font-size: 12px !important; line-height: 15px !important; -moz-tab-size:4; -o-tab-size:4; -webkit-tab-size:4; tab-size:4;"><div class="crayon-line" id="crayon-682e875f1db8c879003368-1">“<span class="crayon-i">wscript</span><span class="crayon-sy">.</span><span class="crayon-i">exe</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span>/<span class="crayon-i">e</span><span class="crayon-sy">:</span><span class="crayon-i">vbscript</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-h">&lt;</span><span class="crayon-e">current </span><span class="crayon-i">directory</span><span class="crayon-h">&gt;</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-sy">$</span><span class="crayon-i">RECYCLE</span><span class="crayon-sy">.</span><span class="crayon-i">BIN</span><span class="crayon-sy">\</span><span class="crayon-i">u</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span><span class="crayon-e">vbs </span><span class="crayon-e">name </span><span class="crayon-i">here</span>”<span class="crayon-sy">.</span><span class="crayon-h"> </span></div></div></td>
					</tr>
				</table>
			</div>
		</div>
<!-- [Format Time: 0.0001 seconds] -->
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_13.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-21300 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_13.png" alt="houdini_13" width="745" height="352" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_13.png 745w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_13-300x142.png 300w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_13-370x175.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 745px) 100vw, 745px" /></a></p>
<p><em>Figure 10 Spreader</em></p>
<p>The server exports some unused functions (they all just have RET instruction). We have seen “wrom.exe” and “server.exe” used as the name in the export table (Figure 11).</p>
<p><a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_14.png" rel="wpdevart_lightbox"><img  class="alignnone size-full wp-image-21297 lozad"  data-src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_14.png" alt="houdini_14" width="608" height="375" data-srcset="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_14.png 608w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_14-300x185.png 300w, https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/10/Houdini_14-370x228.png 370w" sizes="(max-width: 608px) 100vw, 608px" /></a></p>
<p><em>Figure 11 Export table</em></p>
<p>The author used the open source library Indy Components for network communication. They also used BTMemoryModule to load DLLs from memory (without saving it on the disc).</p>
<p>The Hworm implants use a connect-back communication. This means the server (implant) connects back to the client (remotely controlling system). It also has some modules implemented in the server and each module uses its own socket for communication (on the same port defined in the configuration).</p>
<p style="text-align: left;">The following modules provide features of this malware:</p>
<ul>
<li style="text-align: left;"><strong>Screenshot</strong>: Provides the ability to capture screenshots in JPEG/BMP formats</li>
<li style="text-align: left;"><strong>Keylogger</strong>: Provides the ability to log key strokes</li>
<li style="text-align: left;"><strong>Internet IO</strong>: Provides the ability to download and execute files from the internet. It also provides the ability to load the executables via the RunPE technique</li>
<li style="text-align: left;"><strong>File Manager</strong>: Provides the ability to list files and directories, delete, rename, and execute files, and upload or download files via TCP or HTTP</li>
<li style="text-align: left;"><strong>Password</strong>: Provides the ability to steal passwords from Firefox, Opera, and Chrome browsers</li>
<li style="text-align: left;"><strong>Misc</strong>: Provides the ability to list processes or modules and kill running processes</li>
<li style="text-align: left;"><strong>USB Notifier</strong>: Provides the ability to notify the controller when a USB device is attached</li>
<li style="text-align: left;"><strong>Houdini Client</strong>: Provides the main client, which contains the server’s configuration.</li>
</ul>
<h3>Final Thoughts:</h3>
<p>The similarities in coding styles and features of the server, as well as languages and handles used by the author of the malware, lead us to believe the beta builder is a version of Hworm which was created somewhere between the HTTP version and the version used in the above outlined attack.</p>
<p>As this RAT can be found online in semi-public locations it is possible the malware is used by both surgical threat actors as well as within casual compromises. The above attack is only one such campaign Unit 42 has discovered using the Delphi versions of Hworm.</p>
<p>Palo Alto Networks customers can use AutoFocus to find all versions of Hworm samples using the “Hworm” tag.</p>
<h3>Indicators:</h3>
<p><strong>Delphi Hworm Beta Builder</strong><br />
a4c71f862757e3535b305a14ff9f268e6cf196b2e54b426f25fa65bf658a9242</p>
<p><strong>Delivery Files</strong><br />
70c55fef53fd4bdeb135ed68a7eead45e8d4ba7d17e0fd907e9770b2793b60ed<br />
9af85e46344dadf1467c71d66865c7af98a23151025e7d8993bd9afc5150ad7d<br />
773716bc2d313e17326471289a0b552f90086a2687fa958ef8cdb611cbc9a8c9<br />
e0db0982c437c40ceb67970e0a776e9448f428e919200b5f7a0566c58680070c<br />
1f45e5eca8f8882481b13fd4a67ffa88a1aa4d6e875a9c2e1fbf0b80e92d9588<br />
5e42e61340942fc0c46a6668a7f54adbbb4792b01c819bcd3047e855116ae16f<br />
fec925721b6563fec32d7a4cf8df777c647f0e24454fa783569f65cdadff9e03<br />
106934ff7f6f93a371a4561fff23d69e6783512c38126fbd427ed4a886ca6e65<br />
ba739f3f415efe005fbed6fcfcb1e6d3b3ae64e9a8d2b0566ab913f73530887c<br />
0672e47513aefcbc3f7a9bd50849acf507a5454bc8c36580304105479c58772a</p>
<p><strong>Payloads</strong><br />
386057a265619c43ef245857b66241a66822061ce9bd047556c4f3f1d262ef36<br />
44b52baf2ecef2f928a13b17ba3a5552c32ca4a640e6421b8bc35ef5a113801b<br />
8428857b0c7dfe43cf2182dd585dfdfd845697a11c31e91d909dc400222b4f78<br />
d69e0456ddb11b979bf303b8bb9f87322bd2a9542dd9d9f716100c40bd6decd1<br />
bd5d64234e1ac87955f1d86ee1af34bd8fd11e8edf3a449181234bb62816acab<br />

<p><strong>Decoy files</strong><br />

<p><strong>Command and Control Network Locations</strong><br />
start.loginto[.]me<br />
samah.sytes[.]net<br />
52.42.161[.]75<br />
78.47.96[.]17<br />
136.243.104[.]200</p>
      
              </div>
              <!--<span class="post__date">Updated 25 October, 2016 at 9:29 AM PDT</span>-->

              <div class="card-content">
                <div class="card-content__wrapper">
                  <a class="card-category" href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/category/threat-research/" role="link" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="unit42-houdinis-magic-reappearance:related-resources:Lampion Is Back With ClickFix Lures:Threat Research"><span class=""><img src="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/icon-threat-research.svg" alt=" category icon">Threat Research</span></a>                        <span class="post-pub-date"><time datetime="2025-05-06T10:00:59+00:00">May 6, 2025</time></span>
                  <a href="https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/lampion-malware-clickfix-lures/" data-page-track="true" data-page-track-value="unit42-houdinis-magic-reappearance:related-resources:Lampion Is Back With ClickFix Lures">
                    <h4 class="post-title">Lampion Is Back With ClickFix Lures</h4>
